The relief bill is the largest one-day expansion of government power in U.S. history.

By Thomas Gallatin

As the dust settles following Congress‚Äôs hurried passage of the¬†emergency relief package Link: https://patriotpost.us/articles/69507-the-senates-2-dollars-2-cents-trillion-economic-lifeline-2020-03-26 known as the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act, spending details of the 880-page, $2.2 trillion behemoth are now becoming known, and it‚Äôs not a pretty sight. While billions of dollars go for needed virus relief, roughly $600 billion goes into government coffers. It‚Äôs the biggest one-day expansion of government power ever, with the vast majority going to increase the welfare state.

It‚Äôs clear that Big Government proponents, especially the Democrats led by Speaker Nancy Pelosi, followed Rahm Emanuel‚Äôs advice and didn‚Äôt let this crisis go to waste. What may be an even greater danger than government expansion is the precedent this crisis action has produced. Now, even more Americans will look first to the government to bail them out of a crisis, costing billions and saddlin‚Ä¶

The Army Asked Retirees in Medical Fields to Come Back. The Response Was Overwhelming Link: https://txarmyvet.blogspot.com/2020/03/the-army-asked-retirees-in-medical.html

Posted by: Tex Link: https://www.blogger.com/profile/03135553145190778309 Tuesday, March 31, 2020 Link: https://txarmyvet.blogspot.com/2020/03/the-army-asked-retirees-in-medical.html

By Hope Hodge Seck

Days ago, the U.S. Army sent out an unusual plea to its retired officers and enlisted soldiers: If you served in one of eight high-demand medical specialties, it said, you may be able to "re-join the team" in order to help the service fight the coronavirus pandemic.

"We need to hear from you STAT!" the message from the Army's head of personnel, Lt. Gen. Thomas Seamands, read.

The Army's retirees took that seriously.

"We reached out to more than 800,000 retired Soldiers to gauge their willingness to assist with the COVID-19 pandemic response," an Army spokesperson told Military.com Friday. To date, more than 14,000 retirees "representing various specialties" have contacted the service for more information, he said.

That comes out to a remarkable response rate of 1.75% -- and that figure may grow considerably. Between Thursday evening and Friday, the pool of respondents increased by 5,000.

Seamands' message said the‚Ä¶

Posted by: Aunty Remm Tuesday, March 31, 2020 Link: https://txarmyvet.blogspot.com/2020/03/army-suspends-transition-to-new-combat.html

30 Mar 2020 Military.com|By¬†Matthew Cox Link: https://www.military.com/author/matthew-cox The¬†U.S. Army Link: http://www.military.com/army has suspended its plan to have all soldiers begin taking the new Army Combat¬†Fitness Link: https://www.military.com/military-fitness Test in October amid widespread gym closures to prevent the spread of the¬†coronavirus Link: https://www.military.com/topics/coronavirus-covid-19 . Army leaders made the decision late last week to suspend the ACFT start date, as it is unclear when soldiers will have access to the fitness equipment needed to prepare for the more challenging fitness test, Lt. Col. Robin Ochoa told Military.com. The Army unveiled its plan to replace the current three-event Army Physical Fitness Test with the six-event ACFT in July 2018, a move that launched a year-long field test involving 60 battalions of soldiers, as well as contract awards for special fitness equipment to administer the new test. The test was set to become a service-wide requirement Oct. 1. For now, the official start date has been "suspended until further notice," Ochoa said, explaining that the current APFT "is still the standard so those pas‚Ä¶

By Allen West - The Old School Patriot

Here in Texas, we have the organization founded by a white supremacist and racist, Margaret Sanger‚Äôs Planned Parenthood, suing the state of Texas because their clinics were not deemed ‚Äúessential.‚Äù Imagine the unthinkable hypocrisy that at a time when we are fighting to save lives, by choosing life, we have an organization wanting to take more lives, innocent lives. One they deem as an essential function?

Well, it appears we have another epidemic, virus, spreading throughout our America. We recently shared a post with y‚Äôall abo‚Ä¶
